intro: Psychotria melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant is also notable for its medicinal uses in traditional medicine, though its chemical composition remains under study.
